verb.description: Put forward (someone or something) with approval as being suitable for a particular purpose or role.
examples: George had recommended some local architects
a book I recommended to a friend of mine

verb.description: Commend or entrust someone or something to (someone)
examples: I devoutly recommended my spirit to its maker

origin: Late Middle English (in recommend (sense 2)): from medieval Latin recommendare, from Latin re- (expressing intensive force) + commendare commit to the care of.
